wikipedia_page.main: Major John Sackville Richard Tufton, 2nd Baron Hothfield,  (8 November 1873 – 21 December 1952) was a British Army officer, farmer and land owner who played first-class cricket for Kent County Cricket Club. He served during the Second Boer War and First World War and succeeded to his title as the 2nd Baron Hothfield in 1926.

response: Tudor was devastated by Larissa's death in 1926 and took flowers or arranged for flowers to be delivered to her grave each 10 June until a few years before his own death. However, he remarried quickly, to Hon. Noreen Rosamund Anne Tufton, daughter of John Tufton, 2nd Baron Hothfield.Occleshaw, pp. 167–168Hon. Noreen Rosamund Anne Tufton, The Peerage.com, retrieved 17 November 2016. Tudor was readmitted to his former regiment in 1927 albeit serving only at extra regimental duty where he was quickly promoted.
*John Tufton, 2nd Baron Hothfield (1873–1952), British Army officer, farmer and land owner, and cricketer
